isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - INSTALL - BLEEDING HYDRO-MAX™ BOOSTER AND BACKUP PUMP ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: BLEEDING HYDRO-MAX™ BOOSTER AND BACKUP PUMP ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Before bleeding the system, be sure that all hose clamps and line fittings are tightened to specifications.
Check that the power steering pump reservoir is full. Use only power steering fluid recommended in the LUBRICATION section of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
If the backup pump was replaced, just apply the brakes to cycle the pump. This will purge the system of any air. Inspect power steering pump reservoir level and add fluid if required.

If the Hydro-Max™ booster was replaced, start the engine and apply the brakes two or three times to purge the booster assembly of air. Inspect power steering pump reservoir level and add fluid if required. If the complete system is evacuated of fluid, refer to the GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for detailed instructions for bleeding the system.
